body:
I keep meaning to add a flag to allow people to add headers...

What would the header need to be?

x-amz-request-payer:requester

On Tue, Jan 19, 2016 at 3:31 PM, Nick Craig-Wood notifications@github.com
wrote:

> I keep meaning to add a flag to allow people to add headers...
> 
> What would the header need to be?
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/301#issuecomment-173009152.

## 

Ryan Layer

Here is more from amazon:

http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/ObjectsinRequesterPaysBuckets.html
http://www.google.com/url?q=http%3A%2F%2Fdocs.aws.amazon.com%2FAmazonS3%2Flatest%2Fdev%2FObjectsinRequesterPaysBuckets.html&sa=D&sntz=1&usg=AFQjCNG0ywhWK-L5CupbkyzxJKHWwgmFmg

On Tue, Jan 19, 2016 at 3:33 PM, Ryan Layer ryan.layer@gmail.com wrote:

> x-amz-request-payer:requester
> 
> On Tue, Jan 19, 2016 at 3:31 PM, Nick Craig-Wood <notifications@github.com
> 
> > wrote:
> > 
> > I keep meaning to add a flag to allow people to add headers...
> > 
> > What would the header need to be?
> > 
> > —
> > Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> > https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/301#issuecomment-173009152.
> 
> ## 
> 
> Ryan Layer

## 

Ryan Layer

This looks relatively simple to add to the [Get](https://godoc.org/github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go/service/s3#GetObjectInput) and [Put](https://godoc.org/github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go/service/s3#PutObjectInput) code just setting the `RequestPayer` attribute to `requester`.

It could be controlled by a flag `--s3-requester-pay`

Any takers?

Yes please!

On Wed, Jan 20, 2016 at 10:03 AM, Nick Craig-Wood notifications@github.com
wrote:

> This looks relatively simple to add to the Get
> https://godoc.org/github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go/service/s3#GetObjectInput
> and Put
> https://godoc.org/github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go/service/s3#PutObjectInput
> code just setting the RequestPayer attribute to requester.
> 
> It could be controlled by a flag --s3-requester-pay
> 
> Any takers?
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/301#issuecomment-173275092.

## 

Ryan Layer

If it is just a question of adding a header then you can do it with one of these flags

     --header stringArray            Set HTTP header for all transactions
      --header-download stringArray   Set HTTP header for download transactions
      --header-upload stringArray     Set HTTP header for upload transactions

Can you try it and see if it works?

Tried using the following argument `--header "x-amz-request-payer:requester"` but had this error:
`ERROR : : error reading source directory: AccessDenied: There were headers present in the request which were not signed`

@rlaunch - you'll need a space, and you want to use --header-upload or --header-download depending on whether you are uploading or downloading.

    --header-upload "x-amz-request-payer: requester"

or

    --header-download "x-amz-request-payer: requester"

If that doesn't work can you run with `-vv --dump headers` and paste some debug.

issue.title: s3: add requester pays option - fixes #301

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you very much for contributing code or documentation to rclone! Please
fill out the following questions to make it easier for us to review your
changes.

You do not need to check all the boxes below all at once, feel free to take
your time and add more commits. If you're done and ready for review, please
check the last box.
-->

#### What is the purpose of this change?

Support AWS S3 [Requester Pays](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/RequesterPaysBuckets.html) as a configurable option.

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

Yes - https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/301.

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-pull-request).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

body: I've merged @kelvk 's fix for this this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) in 15-30 mins and released in v1.54 - thank you!
